text: Nich thank you for your information.

``` {% form
      form_to_use="{{ module.form.form_id }}"
      response_response_type="{{ module.form.response_type }}"
      response_message="{{ module.form.message }}"
      response_redirect_id="{{ module.form.redirect_id }}"
      response_redirect_url="{{module.form.redirect_url}}"
    %}```
Hello everyone
Just curious: How can I add the redirect URL to a new tab for the excerpts above?
Thank you!
Does querying the CRM in HubL count against API limits?
I'm pretty sure it doesn't
Wouldn't make any sense
yeah agreed
Not at my setup now so can't test but I will when I get home
no worries, still looking up on my end also

When you’re inside of a set of percentage braces (`{%`), you don’t need to enclose your HubL variables in double braces (`{{`)—you’ve already indicated that anything inside the tag should be interpreted as HubL. _(There’s one important exception to this: when you’re using a variable inside of a string inside of a HubL tag)_

If I’m interpreting what you’re trying to do here correctly, you’re trying to pass the value of the variable `user_region` into the update function as the key for a dictionary value, correct?

In that case, something like this should do it:
`{% do userRegionArray.update(user_region: true) %}`

One thing I do want to make sure of: your variable is named `userRegionArray`, implying that it contains an array. However, the `update()` function is for objects with of the dictionary data type — not arrays.

Totally understand if it’s just an inaccurately named variable _(been there, feel that)_, but wanted to make sure you don’t spend too much time troubleshooting something that isn’t ever going to work. :~)
hey there - year its a object but used to be a array, just me forgetting to rename it lol
Hah, totally understand — figured I should say something _just in case_.
I did try {% do userRegionArray.update(user_region: true) %} and still no dice though, unfortunately
BUT I think I might know whats going on
any idea if HubL has a "toLowerCase" equiv?

I’m not sure that’s something that’s supported out of the box. Usually the purpose of a post-submission redirect is to navigate the user away from the form, to prevent things like double-submissions due to confusion over the submission state. Opening the redirect in a new tab would defeat that purpose.

If you’re looking to open a window when a user submits a form, you’d probably be better off setting the form to display an inline thank you message, and then use Javascript to open the new window you want to display.
Sure does! You’re looking for <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#lower|the >`lower`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#lower| filter>.
sweet
You’ve got user_region wrapped in double braces again. ;~)
erm sorry - same result blehhhh
guessing there's no way to do string interpolation with HubL?

Actually, you do string interpolation with the edge case I mentioned in my first reply! That’s the one case where you _would_ use double braces inside of a set of percentage braces.

`{% set string_with_interp = "Foo bar status: {{ variable_baz }}" %}`
hmmmmmm just seems like the update method isn't set up to accept it :v
There’s also a filter for string type coercion: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#string>
woah I was looking for something like that, dang
hmmm yeah, wonder why hubl can't accept interpolation in parameters
HubL tends to be a lot more resilient than you might expect. I’d try doing some debug outputs on the data you’re looping through to make sure it’s actually in the format you expect.
yeah I'm guessing I just need to do a if statement instead of having it dynamically do it

It’s certainly a possibility. I do have one other alternative solution: could you access the object values using bracket notation?

`{% set userRegionArray[user_region] = true %}`
ooh good idea, let me try that
I can’t remember if HubL supports that off the top of my head — I might be thinking Nunjucks right now.
yeah no support
wish they would just give us straight up jinja :v
Sure thing! Sorry that I couldn’t help you get your preferred solution working, but sometimes the cards just don’t play out like that.
oh no worries, it helped to talk it out so I appreciate it and hope I can return the favor
I had a fun time chatting it out! Also, always good to learn more about the quirks and details of the tools I use every day. :)
HubL has historically not required map keys to require quotation marks so a map like `{user_region: true}` is interpreted as `{'user_region': true}`  (which is unfortunate)

But don't fear, cause you can do:
```{% do userRegionArray.put(user_region, true) %}```
oh dang lmao

Oh, that would absolutely explain it. I’ve never even thought to try *not* using quotes for keys.

Thanks for the enlightenment — super useful to know. :)

> wish they would just give us straight up jinja :v
 `{% set userRegionArray[user_region] = true %}`  isn't allowed in jinja either. Jinja doesn't let you update maps with arbitrary keys/values. But HubL does because it's a legacy feature.
